Protection of SC for Death
38 CFR 3.957
provides protection against severance of SC for the cause of death, dependency and indemnity compensation (DIC), and death compensation.  In general, SC death will not be severed after the decision has been in effect for 10 or more years except upon a showing that the original grant was based on fraud or it is clearly shown from military records that the person concerned did not have the requisite service or COD.
Protection for SC for cause of death does not apply to an erroneous grant of DIC when a rating decision determined that death was not SC.
Reference
:  For more information on the inapplicability of protection for an award of DIC based on an erroneous grant, see
VAOPGCPREC 8-1993
.
